abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for project were as follows:
            the outcomes was satisfactory, the sustainability was
            likely, the institutional development impact was modest, and
            the Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            The lessons learned show that interagency coordination is a
            key for successful implementation of a cross sectoral
            adjustment program. The high level committee staffed by
            technical experts was established at the outset of the
            reform program. It proved essential to the formulation and
            effective implementation of the reforms. A more focused
            adjustment operation also allows more focused effort and
            attention on specific areas so that more ambitious reforms
            are possible. The Croatia SAL, unlike many adjustment
            operations, did not attempt to address structural problems
            at once across all major economic sectors. This strategy
            meant that pressure could be concentrated on politically
            difficult reforms like labor market flexibility. The
            especially close coordination of the Bank and the Fund
            helped design and fulfill a bold reform program. The
            combined financial resources of the two institutions and the
            overlapping conditionality gave strong leverage to the
            reform program, which government officials reported was a
            key factor in the program's success. Local consultants
            have good standing among government counterparts and could
            be used more widely in Bank operations. The Bank learned in
            some components (e.g. Social Protection) that local
            consultants are highly capable and more knowledgeable about
            local conditions. Government counterparts also appreciated
            working with them.

5086338.majtheme: Public sector governance,Social protection and risk management,Financial and private sector development,Economic management

abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Loan Project
            will support the Government's implementation of a
            structural reform program to foster rapid, and sustainable
            economic growth, through macroeconomic stabilization,
            towards integration into the European Union (EU). The reform
            program is designed to attain these goals, through improved
            economic management, and coordination of economic
            policymaking, and, by enhancing fiscal discipline, so as to
            strengthen market institutions, and competitiveness, and in
            addition, will also enhance labor market flexibility, and
            strengthen social protection. Measures for improved budget
            procedures, reduction or elimination of subsidies, and
            monitoring of Government guarantees, and reforms in the
            pension system, will enhance fiscal discipline, while
            reforms in the competition policy, and improvement of
            institutional capacity for resolving business disputes, and
            bankruptcy proceedings, will be supported. Social safety
            nets will target vulnerable groups, aiming at improved cost
            effectiveness of social assistance, and community-based
            social services. However, the retrenchment of the wage bill,
            and reductions in public employment pose risks if not
            attained, and, containing health fund expenditures could
            force the Government to resort to additional foreign
            borrowing. These could undermine the credibility of fiscal
            adjustment, while the slowdown in the world economy (i.e.,
            economic effects of the terrorist events in the US) could
            destabilize both Croatia's EU integration, and capital
            flows, exacerbated by the coalition Government's
            political risks, which could undermine reforms, and policy implementation.
